jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field is a month away!
jobs.text_body:
Hello! The EMF team are hard at work making the final arrangements, and with the opening date just over a month away we've got a few important things to tell you.
Villages -------- EMF attendees often group together into "[villages](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Villages)" hosting content of their own, be it workshops, installations, performances, or tasty snacks for passers by. Villages can rent marquees from us, along with furniture to go inside them. __We'll be closing the village tent rentals at midnight (UTC) on Sunday 29th July__ -- make sure you place an order before then: [https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/hire](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/hire) We'll be opening up registration for villages to publish things in the official schedule soon. We're also looking for villages who are willing to host workshops submitted through our CFP -- email [content@emfcamp.org](mailto:content@emfcamp.org) if you'd like to know more.
Call For Participation ---------------------- Nearly all the content at EMF comes from our Call For Participation, which is __closing at midnight (UTC) on Sunday 29th July__. If you'd like to give a talk or workshop on the main stages, please ensure you submit it before then! We're currently looking for more installations -- especially __interactive installations suitable for small children__ in the youth area (e.g. a giant marble run), and __installations with a "cyber" theme__. If you've got friends still looking for EMF tickets, the CFP is the best way to get them -- all accepted submissions are guaranteed two tickets to the event. Please submit all proposals via the CFP form on our website: [https://www.emfcamp.org/cfp](https://www.emfcamp.org/cfp)
Volunteering ------------ EMF is entirely run by unpaid volunteers, and we rely on everyone helping out at the event. We'll be opening volunteer registration shortly. In the meantime __we really need help with the remaining event organisation__. If you'd like to help make EMF happen, take a look at our volunteering pages for the roles we urgently need to fill: [https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteering](https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteering)
Sponsorship ----------- While your ticket price pays for the core infrastructure to make EMF happen, we rely on sponsorship from lovely organisations to pay for all the extra-nice things we have on site, like free childcare, lounges, live transcription, and the badge. If you know of an organisation that might be willing to help make EMF even better, please get in touch with our sponsorship team: [https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor](https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor)
Tickets, parking tickets, and refunds ------------------------------------- If you've bought an EMF ticket for someone else, please forward this email to them and transfer their ticket [using our website](https://www.emfcamp.org/account/purchases) so they'll receive these updates in the future. There will be an extremely small sale of excess and returned tickets in the next month. Keep an eye on our Facebook and Twitter feeds to find out when it goes live, but be aware that it will sell out almost instantly. If you need parking for your car or campervan, you can still buy a parking pass: [https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/other](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/other) If you can no longer attend EMF and need to return your ticket, the best option is to post on our [Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/emfcamp/), on Twitter (with the [#emfcamp](https://twitter.com/hashtag/emfcamp?f=tweets&vertical=default&src=hash) hashtag), or list it on our [Ticket Exchange](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Ticket_Exchange) wiki page. Once you've found someone to take the tickets, you can transfer them yourself [on our website](https://www.emfcamp.org/account/purchases). In the event you can't find someone to take your ticket, email [tickets@emfcamp.org](mailto:tickets@emfcamp.org) before August 19th to request a refund. We'll be processing these soon.
We'll be in touch closer to the event, and if you've got any questions don't hesitate to contact us.
See you in the field, The EMF Team
jobs.html_body:
Hello!

The EMF team are hard at work making the final arrangements, and with the opening date just over a month away we’ve got a few important things to tell you.

Villages

EMF attendees often group together into “villages” hosting content of their own, be it workshops, installations, performances, or tasty snacks for passers by.

Villages can rent marquees from us, along with furniture to go inside them. We’ll be closing the village tent rentals at midnight (UTC) on Sunday 29th July – make sure you place an order before then:

https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/hire

We’ll be opening up registration for villages to publish things in the official schedule soon. We’re also looking for villages who are willing to host workshops submitted through our CFP – email content@emfcamp.org if you’d like to know more.

Call For Participation

Nearly all the content at EMF comes from our Call For Participation, which is closing at midnight (UTC) on Sunday 29th July. If you’d like to give a talk or workshop on the main stages, please ensure you submit it before then!

We’re currently looking for more installations – especially interactive installations suitable for small children in the youth area (e.g. a giant marble run), and installations with a “cyber” theme.

If you’ve got friends still looking for EMF tickets, the CFP is the best way to get them – all accepted submissions are guaranteed two tickets to the event.

Please submit all proposals via the CFP form on our website:

https://www.emfcamp.org/cfp

Volunteering

EMF is entirely run by unpaid volunteers, and we rely on everyone helping out at the event. We’ll be opening volunteer registration shortly.

In the meantime we really need help with the remaining event organisation. If you’d like to help make EMF happen, take a look at our volunteering pages for the roles we urgently need to fill:

https://www.emfcamp.org/about/volunteering

Sponsorship

While your ticket price pays for the core infrastructure to make EMF happen, we rely on sponsorship from lovely organisations to pay for all the extra-nice things we have on site, like free childcare, lounges, live transcription, and the badge.

If you know of an organisation that might be willing to help make EMF even better, please get in touch with our sponsorship team:

https://www.emfcamp.org/sponsor

Tickets, parking tickets, and refunds

If you’ve bought an EMF ticket for someone else, please forward this email to them and transfer their ticket using our website so they’ll receive these updates in the future.

There will be an extremely small sale of excess and returned tickets in the next month. Keep an eye on our Facebook and Twitter feeds to find out when it goes live, but be aware that it will sell out almost instantly.

If you need parking for your car or campervan, you can still buy a parking pass:

https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/other

If you can no longer attend EMF and need to return your ticket, the best option is to post on our Facebook page, on Twitter (with the #emfcamp hashtag), or list it on our Ticket Exchange wiki page. Once you’ve found someone to take the tickets, you can transfer them yourself on our website.

In the event you can’t find someone to take your ticket, email tickets@emfcamp.org before August 19th to request a refund. We’ll be processing these soon.

We’ll be in touch closer to the event, and if you’ve got any questions don’t hesitate to contact us.

See you in the field,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you have a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2018.

Sent by Electromagnetic Field Ltd.

jobs.subject: Your guaranteed tickets for EMF 2018
jobs.text_body:
Hello,

Thank you for contributing to EMF 2018. The team really appreciate it and can't wait to see what you do!

You can now obtain the tickets for you and a friend that we guarantee for every accepted proposal:

   [https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/speakers](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/speakers)

If the ticket options presented are not suitable for you, please [get in touch](mailto:speakers@emfcamp.org) and we'll find a solution!

See you in the field,
The EMF Team

Thank you for contributing to EMF 2018. The team really appreciate it and can’t wait to see what you do!

If the ticket options presented are not suitable for you, please get in touch and we’ll find a solution!

See you in the field,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you have a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2018.

Sent by Electromagnetic Field Ltd.

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field 2018: Things you need to know
jobs.text_body:
Hello!

Electromagnetic Field is almost here, and the team are frantically building up the site ready for your arrival.

Below you'll find information about getting here, what to bring, and what is going on.

## Tickets

You should have received your tickets via email in the last few days. If you have not received your tickets please [let us know as soon as possible](mailto:tickets@emfcamp.org).

Please print your tickets ready for arrival, however we can scan tickets from a screen if necessary.

## Arriving

You will find comprehensive information on getting to the festival [on our website](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Travel).

If you are arriving in a vehicle please note that you will need a parking ticket. If you do not have one, you can [still buy one](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/other).

For those of you setting up a village, you may be on-site from 4pm on Thursday, but all vehicles must be removed to the parking area by the end of the day.

No vehicles will be allowed into the festival area from Friday morning until Monday morning.

If you're arriving on Friday, the gates will open at 9am.

## Leaving

Our final act will finish by 11pm on Sunday however the bar and other night time areas will be open much later, so we suggest that you stay overnight.

When you leave please take everything you brought, and dispose of any waste in the bins provided. Anything you leave behind will have to be cleared by our volunteers, and will cost us money to remove.

If you're not helping with teardown, you will need to leave the site by 12:00pm on Monday.

## What to bring

Not sure what you need to pack for a weekend at EMF? We've got a checklist of [things to pack](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/What_To_Bring%3F).

### The Most Important Things:

* The EMF schedule is entirely online, so bring something capable of viewing our website.
* If you want to have power to your tent, please bring an extension lead that is at least 30m long.

## Food & Drink

We have a range of food vendors on site, with provision for vegetarians and vegans. There's a full [list of vendors on the website](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/Food).

The on-site vendors may take cards but assume that cash is king. We provide a cash-back service for debit cards in the bar, but please do bring money with you.

Feel free to use your own cooking devices to prepare food, but please keep them raised off the grass.

## Schedule

The EMF talk & workshop schedule [is finally live](https://emfcamp.org/schedule)! Please remember that this can change at short notice, so check it before you trek across site for a session.

If you're planning on attending a workshop at EMF, check the schedule to see if there's anything you need to bring (many require a laptop). Some workshops may charge a small fee.

Workshops at EMF 2018 operate on a first-come-first-served basis - simply show up before the workshop and wait.

## Lightning Talks

Although the Call for Participation is now closed we have slots available for 10-minute lightning talks. If you're interested in talking, drop an email to [lightning@emfcamp.org](mailto:lightning@emfcamp.org), or visit the Green Room after the Opening Ceremony.

## Speaking

All speakers should have received notification of their talk and workshop times. If your slot is unsuitable, or you have not yet heard from us, please email [speakers@emfcamp.org](mailto:speakers@emfcamp.org).

## Badge

Some of you may have seen that we've finally announced the EMF 2018 badge - the incredible TiLDA Mk4. You can [read all about it on our blog](http://blog.emfcamp.org/post/177423823788/tilda-mk4-the-emf-2018-badge).

## Young Attendees

[Nipperbout](https://nipperbout.com) will be providing childcare for under 12s between 09:30 and 19:00. To make use of this, simply drop your children off at the crèche, subject to spaces being available.

There is also a full programme of content for under 13s, hosted in the Youth Workshop tent. An adult must be present to supervise and assist children in the workshops.

## Other things to prepare for
### Swap Shop

At various times throughout the event we'll be running the Swap Shop, a place to beg, haggle, sell, buy, barter and swap your obsolete technology, abandoned projects, unwanted gimmicks, and surplus acquisitions. Bring a box of junk and take away a different one!

### Hebocon

Saturday evening plays host to Hebocon, a robot fighting competition for the technically ungifted. Hosted by Tom Scott & Lucy Rogers (an actual Robot Wars judge!), anyone can take part - just bring along a crappy robot, or build one on-site!

Newcomers to Hebocon might like to take part in [Hebocon Jr](https://www.emfcamp.org/line-up/2018/188-hebocon) on Friday, where you'll be guided through the process of making a terrible combat robot.

## Volunteering

EMF is entirely organised & run by unpaid volunteers, and we ask everybody who attends to try and contribute a few hours of their time helping out on-site. Anybody who works a three-hour shift will be provided with a delicious hot meal from the volunteer lounge!

If you'd like to sign up in advance, please visit our [volunteer system](https://www.emfcamp.org/volunteer/sign-up).

## Code of Conduct
We'd like to remind you that we expect all attendees to adhere to our [Code of Conduct](https://www.emfcamp.org/code-of-conduct). Please read it before the event.

## Anything else?
If [our FAQ](https://wiki.emfcamp.org/wiki/FAQ) can't answer your question please send an email to [contact@emfcamp.org](mailto:contact@emfcamp.org).

## Thanks
Without the support we have received from our amazing sponsors none of this would be possible. We are indebted to [Lucid](https://luc.id), [Mathworks](https://uk.mathworks.com/), [Nexmo](https://www.nexmo.com/), [privateinternetaccess](https://privateinternetaccess.com/), [Lyst](https://www.lyst.co.uk/), [Texas Instruments](http://www.ti.com/), [HCD](http://www.hcduk.com/), [Lime microsystems](https://limemicro.com/), [Hologram](https://hologram.io/), [Codethink](https://www.codethink.co.uk/), [Github](https://github.com/), [mLab](https://mlab.com/), [Andrews & Arnold](https://aaisp.net.uk/), [AMSAT-UK](https://amsat-uk.org/), [Medical Connections](http://www.medicalconnections.co.uk/), [MSRaynsford.co.uk](http://www.msraynsford.co.uk/), [Onega](https://www.onega.net/), and [Smoke & Mirrors](https://smokeandmirrors.store/).


See you in the field,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you have a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2018.

Sent by Electromagnetic Field Ltd.

jobs.subject: Electromagnetic Field 2018, four months later
jobs.text_body: Hello, This email has been sent to everyone who bought EMF tickets; if you bought tickets for others please forward it on. It's taken us longer than usual to finish the post-event work this year, but here we are! Time to take a look back at what happened in 2018 and the things that will happen before the next EMF in 2020. Catching up ----------- Almost every talk at EMF is available to watch [on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/ElectromagneticField) and for download from [media.ccc.de](https://media.ccc.de/b/conferences/emf/2018). Please note: a few speakers chose not to have their talks recorded at the last minute, and a tiny number of talks were not published due to equipment failure - we’re still hoping to recover them. Satellite photography 🛰 ------------------------ We know you’ve been holding your breath for satellite images. The satellites were all given the EMF site as a low priority, meaning they would only turn and image us if they didn’t have more important things to do. Unfortunately, due to a mix of higher-priority tasking and thick cloud cover, they never managed to capture the EMF site during the 18 passes made over the event... ... but they did manage to capture it just after we left. (Click for a less cropped image) This image was taken by [GeoEye-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GeoEye-1). You can clearly see where the main paths, catering, and Null Sector were. It's not what we hoped for, but still, our ghost was visible from orbit. Most importantly: DigitalGlobe have said they'd like to try again in 2020! If you'd like to see the extremely high-resolution image of the entire area around EMF, you can find it [here](https://archive.org/details/emf_2018_satellite_photo). T-shirts -------- We've got a second run of t-shirts in the works! They'll only be on sale until 10th February, so snap them up quickly. You can place your order in [our ticket shop](https://www.emfcamp.org/tickets/tees). T-shirts ordered now will ship in late February. If you've already ordered a t-shirt, it's in the post today. Expect a package 📦 Who is EMF? ----------- We'd really like to know more about the EMF attendees to help us gauge how the community is developing, and how our outreach is progressing. It will also enable us to correctly represent the event when applying for grants from funding organisations - such as the one from Arts Council England that allowed us to build Null Sector this year. [Filling in this short survey](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfgauwtwGcsBAfnbi3E68b2uawOXF41EMiOXDKKvpujt0mc-A/viewform) should only take a few minutes. It's completely anonymous, and all questions are optional. Just tell us what you're comfortable with. Feedback -------- We really value feedback, both good and bad. Please let us know about things you think we need to change, but also please tell us about the little things that made EMF 2018 special for you - we to love to hear your stories. There's an [anonymous feedback form on our website](https://www.emfcamp.org/feedback), and we read every response. Your photos & videos -------------------- We love seeing all the photos and videos you took at EMF, and we really appreciate everybody taking the time to share them. If you would like to share your media with us, [please fill in this form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdqvJG9loGOWH9uEQEGvq5PfDZE0YYt4xsu8hjgpAhMKvZ0PQ/viewform). For everything we've been sent so far take a look at our [2018 Internet Archive collection](https://archive.org/details/emfcamp?and%5B%5D=year%3A%222018%22). Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP) --------------------------- In the [closing ceremony](https://media.ccc.de/v/emf2018-487-closing-ceremony) we announced that EMF will be starting a new series of small events across the country called Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP). These are small meetups that give the wider community a regular place to meet up & hang out between EMFs, to talk about and show projects, and plan for the future. They'll also be a great place to get involved with EMF organisation. While the first events are likely to be in cities where some of the current EMF team live, we would like to see them happen elsewhere - and anyone can start one! The first event will be early this year. If you'd like to find out more and sign up for notifications about EMPs in your area, you can do so here: [https://emfcamp.org/emp](https://emfcamp.org/emp) Badge ----- **Availability** Those of you that saw the [badge talk](https://media.ccc.de/v/emf2018-491-the-making-of-tilda-mk4) this year know that because of manufacturing problems we had substantially fewer badges than expected. If you did not get a badge and would still like one, please [fill in this form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfCoWSbdBU73JUtXIYIEwFwqggOB4ysbMIIg6yqhTlHMP0u2g/viewform) and we'll do our best to get one to you, although we cannot promise it will be possible. If you have a badge that you no longer want and would be willing to give it to someone else, please email [contact@emfcamp.org](mailto:contact@emfcamp.org) and we'll gladly re-home it. **Signal problems** By the time we debugged and fixed the widespread problems with badges connecting to the on-site GSM network the event was almost over. However voice calls should work fine off-site - simply put a 2G SIM card in your badge. If you're getting interference noise, [bend the antenna so it points downwards](https://badge.emfcamp.org/w/images/9/98/EMF_Badge_Antenna_Mod.jpg), or if you're feeling adventurous you can use the provided pads to solder on an [SMA edge connector](https://uk.rs-online.com/web/p/sma-connectors/5265785/) and use a [proper antenna](https://twitter.com/MatthewHarrold/status/1040238996436254720). **Software** Many critical issues with the badge software were fixed both during and after the event. You can find full update instructions [on the badge wiki](https://badge.emfcamp.org/wiki/TiLDA_MK4/Firmware_Update). **Competition** Every year, we run a competition for the best thing built using the badge. The winner gets two free tickets to the next EMF! If you'd like to enter please [submit your app](https://badge.emfcamp.org/wiki/TiLDA_MK4/Badge_Store_Submissions) to the badge store, or email your hack to [badge@emfcamp.org](mailto:badge@emfcamp.org) by *1st December 2019*. Given the demand for tickets, this is a great way to secure yours for 2020! Stickers -------- If you missed out on EMF stickers at the event and would like some, please send a stamped self-addressed envelope to: > Electromagnetic Field > 646 Commercial Rd, > Poplar, > London > E14 7HA If you're outside the UK and having trouble getting British stamps, don't worry - we'll cover the return postage for you. Perhaps put something nice in the envelope to motivate us. The problems ------------ Those of you who saw the [opening](https://media.ccc.de/v/emf2018-486-opening-ceremony) and [closing](https://media.ccc.de/v/emf2018-487-closing-ceremony) ceremonies know that EMF 2018 was plagued with issues that caused us substantial unexpected expenditure and almost caused the event to be cancelled. As a result we had to make many compromises on-site, and the event was not delivered to the standard we planned. We're very happy to report that while some supplier disputes are ongoing, the event made a small surplus and we'll be able to carry that forward. EMF is committed to being as transparent as possible, and we will publish a breakdown of the event costs when possible. Helping others -------------- When EMF makes a surplus, we use some of that money to help other groups in the wider community. This year we chose to fund the [DotEveryone Fairer Tech Events scheme](https://doteveryone.org.uk/project/fairer-tech-events/). From our donation they are providing three grants of up to £500 to help other tech events become more accessible, by providing support like childcare, travel bursaries, and speaker training. EMF 2020 -------- We're planning to return to Eastnor for our next event in 2020 and hope to schedule it slightly earlier in the year. The dates will be fixed in around six months and tickets will go on sale by January 2020. Future of EMF ------------- We're trying to make EMF a more sustainable organisation, spreading the work and ensuring we look after our volunteers - but this only works if we grow the team. Jonty and Russ intend to step back as the main organisers after the 2020 event, and we want to make sure that every team is fully staffed so they can do so. If you'd like to get involved in the event organisation we'd love to hear from you. Please drop an email to [contact@emfcamp.org](mailto:contact@emfcamp.org) to express your interest - we might take a little while to get back to you, but every email is read. Not all teams kick off at the same time, so if you see us doing things don't be disheartened. You can also get involved through the [EMP events](https://emfcamp.org/emp) as we'll have EMF team members you can talk to at many of them. EMF News -------- If you'd like to be notified about future EMF things, such as new EMP meetings or other events we're excited about, you can [join our mailing list](https://www.emfcamp.org/subscribe). Thanks ------ The EMF team thanks everyone who contributed to the 2018 event in any way, and those who have supported us throughout the years. Thank you for believing what we do is worthwhile. We couldn't do this without you, and we're so excited to see how this community keeps growing! We would also like to specially thank [Lucid](https://luc.id), for taking over the youth sponsorship at the last minute after others fell through: > We hope you had a great EMF! Lucid is looking for developers of all kinds, along with infrastructure people - and we're remote friendly! Take a look at the [roles we have open](https://angel.co/lucid-london-engineering). See you in 2020! We are also indebted to [Mathworks](https://uk.mathworks.com/), [Nexmo](https://www.nexmo.com/), [privateinternetaccess](https://privateinternetaccess.com/), [Lyst](https://www.lyst.co.uk/), [Texas Instruments](http://www.ti.com/), [HCD](http://www.hcduk.com/), [Lime microsystems](https://limemicro.com/), [Hologram](https://hologram.io/), [Codethink](https://www.codethink.co.uk/), [Github](https://github.com/), [mLab](https://mlab.com/), [Andrews & Arnold](https://aaisp.net.uk/), [AMSAT-UK](https://amsat-uk.org/), [Medical Connections](http://www.medicalconnections.co.uk/), [MSRaynsford.co.uk](http://www.msraynsford.co.uk/), [Onega](https://www.onega.net/), and [Smoke & Mirrors](https://smokeandmirrors.store/) for their sponsorship this year. Until next time --------------- We hope you had fun at EMF in 2018. If you want to attend something a bit like EMF this year, CCC Camp will take place 21st August - 25th August at Ziegeleipark Mildenberg, just outside Berlin. When more information is announced (including ticket sales) we'll post about it on [our Twitter feed](https://twitter.com/emfcamp) and [mailing list](https://www.emfcamp.org/subscribe). See you in 2020, if not before then. Yours, The EMF Team
jobs.html_body:
Hello,

This email has been sent to everyone who bought EMF tickets; if you bought tickets for others please forward it on.

It’s taken us longer than usual to finish the post-event work this year, but here we are! Time to take a look back at what happened in 2018 and the things that will happen before the next EMF in 2020.

Catching up

Almost every talk at EMF is available to watch on YouTube and for download from media.ccc.de.

Please note: a few speakers chose not to have their talks recorded at the last minute, and a tiny number of talks were not published due to equipment failure - we’re still hoping to recover them.

Satellite photography 🛰

We know you’ve been holding your breath for satellite images.

The satellites were all given the EMF site as a low priority, meaning they would only turn and image us if they didn’t have more important things to do.

Unfortunately, due to a mix of higher-priority tasking and thick cloud cover, they never managed to capture the EMF site during the 18 passes made over the event…

… but they did manage to capture it just after we left.


(Click for a less cropped image)

This image was taken by GeoEye-1. You can clearly see where the main paths, catering, and Null Sector were. It’s not what we hoped for, but still, our ghost was visible from orbit.

Most importantly: DigitalGlobe have said they’d like to try again in 2020!

If you’d like to see the extremely high-resolution image of the entire area around EMF, you can find it here.

T-shirts

We’ve got a second run of t-shirts in the works! They’ll only be on sale until 10th February, so snap them up quickly.

You can place your order in our ticket shop. T-shirts ordered now will ship in late February.

If you’ve already ordered a t-shirt, it’s in the post today. Expect a package 📦

Who is EMF?

We’d really like to know more about the EMF attendees to help us gauge how the community is developing, and how our outreach is progressing. It will also enable us to correctly represent the event when applying for grants from funding organisations - such as the one from Arts Council England that allowed us to build Null Sector this year.

Filling in this short survey should only take a few minutes. It’s completely anonymous, and all questions are optional. Just tell us what you’re comfortable with.

Feedback

We really value feedback, both good and bad. Please let us know about things you think we need to change, but also please tell us about the little things that made EMF 2018 special for you - we to love to hear your stories.

There’s an anonymous feedback form on our website, and we read every response.

Your photos & videos

We love seeing all the photos and videos you took at EMF, and we really appreciate everybody taking the time to share them.

If you would like to share your media with us, please fill in this form.

For everything we’ve been sent so far take a look at our 2018 Internet Archive collection.

Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP)

In the closing ceremony we announced that EMF will be starting a new series of small events across the country called Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP).

These are small meetups that give the wider community a regular place to meet up & hang out between EMFs, to talk about and show projects, and plan for the future. They’ll also be a great place to get involved with EMF organisation.

While the first events are likely to be in cities where some of the current EMF team live, we would like to see them happen elsewhere - and anyone can start one!

The first event will be early this year. If you’d like to find out more and sign up for notifications about EMPs in your area, you can do so here: https://emfcamp.org/emp

Badge

Availability

Those of you that saw the badge talk this year know that because of manufacturing problems we had substantially fewer badges than expected.

If you did not get a badge and would still like one, please fill in this form and we’ll do our best to get one to you, although we cannot promise it will be possible.

If you have a badge that you no longer want and would be willing to give it to someone else, please email contact@emfcamp.org and we’ll gladly re-home it.

Signal problems

By the time we debugged and fixed the widespread problems with badges connecting to the on-site GSM network the event was almost over.

However voice calls should work fine off-site - simply put a 2G SIM card in your badge. If you’re getting interference noise, bend the antenna so it points downwards, or if you’re feeling adventurous you can use the provided pads to solder on an SMA edge connector and use a proper antenna.

Software

Many critical issues with the badge software were fixed both during and after the event. You can find full update instructions on the badge wiki.

Competition

Every year, we run a competition for the best thing built using the badge. The winner gets two free tickets to the next EMF!

If you’d like to enter please submit your app to the badge store, or email your hack to badge@emfcamp.org by 1st December 2019.

Given the demand for tickets, this is a great way to secure yours for 2020!

Stickers

If you missed out on EMF stickers at the event and would like some, please send a stamped self-addressed envelope to:

Electromagnetic Field
646 Commercial Rd,
Poplar,
London
E14 7HA

If you’re outside the UK and having trouble getting British stamps, don’t worry - we’ll cover the return postage for you. Perhaps put something nice in the envelope to motivate us.

The problems

Those of you who saw the opening and closing ceremonies know that EMF 2018 was plagued with issues that caused us substantial unexpected expenditure and almost caused the event to be cancelled. As a result we had to make many compromises on-site, and the event was not delivered to the standard we planned.

We’re very happy to report that while some supplier disputes are ongoing, the event made a small surplus and we’ll be able to carry that forward.

EMF is committed to being as transparent as possible, and we will publish a breakdown of the event costs when possible.

Helping others

When EMF makes a surplus, we use some of that money to help other groups in the wider community.

This year we chose to fund the DotEveryone Fairer Tech Events scheme. From our donation they are providing three grants of up to £500 to help other tech events become more accessible, by providing support like childcare, travel bursaries, and speaker training.

EMF 2020

We’re planning to return to Eastnor for our next event in 2020 and hope to schedule it slightly earlier in the year. The dates will be fixed in around six months and tickets will go on sale by January 2020.

Future of EMF

We’re trying to make EMF a more sustainable organisation, spreading the work and ensuring we look after our volunteers - but this only works if we grow the team.

Jonty and Russ intend to step back as the main organisers after the 2020 event, and we want to make sure that every team is fully staffed so they can do so.

If you’d like to get involved in the event organisation we’d love to hear from you. Please drop an email to contact@emfcamp.org to express your interest - we might take a little while to get back to you, but every email is read. Not all teams kick off at the same time, so if you see us doing things don’t be disheartened.

You can also get involved through the EMP events as we’ll have EMF team members you can talk to at many of them.

EMF News

If you’d like to be notified about future EMF things, such as new EMP meetings or other events we’re excited about, you can join our mailing list.

Thanks

The EMF team thanks everyone who contributed to the 2018 event in any way, and those who have supported us throughout the years. Thank you for believing what we do is worthwhile.

We couldn’t do this without you, and we’re so excited to see how this community keeps growing!

We would also like to specially thank Lucid, for taking over the youth sponsorship at the last minute after others fell through:

We hope you had a great EMF! Lucid is looking for developers of all kinds, along with infrastructure people - and we’re remote friendly! Take a look at the roles we have open. See you in 2020!

We are also indebted to Mathworks, Nexmo, privateinternetaccess, Lyst, Texas Instruments, HCD, Lime microsystems, Hologram, Codethink, Github, mLab, Andrews & Arnold, AMSAT-UK, Medical Connections, MSRaynsford.co.uk, Onega, and Smoke & Mirrors for their sponsorship this year.

Until next time

We hope you had fun at EMF in 2018. If you want to attend something a bit like EMF this year, CCC Camp will take place 21st August - 25th August at Ziegeleipark Mildenberg, just outside Berlin. When more information is announced (including ticket sales) we’ll post about it on our Twitter feed and mailing list.

See you in 2020, if not before then.

Yours,
The EMF Team

You're receiving this email because you had a ticket for Electromagnetic Field 2018.

Sent by Electromagnetic Field Ltd.
